q: What is the primary goal of the background chapter on distributed cache?
Why is background knowledge important before designing a distributed cache?
What key concern do writing policies address?
opts: Order of writing data to cache and database

q: Which factor is most affected by the order of data writing?
Which writing policy writes to both cache and database synchronously or sequentially?
What is a disadvantage of the write-through cache policy?
In which writing policy is data first written to cache and later to the database asynchronously?
What is a major risk of write-back caching?
Which writing policy writes data only to the database initially?
Why is write-around cache not ideal for recently updated data?
Why do caches require eviction policies?
Which eviction policy removes the least recently accessed item?
Which eviction policy removes the most frequently accessed item?
What problem does cache invalidation primarily address?
What metadata is commonly used to detect stale cache entries?
Which cache invalidation method checks TTL during access time?
Which cache invalidation method uses a background process to remove expired items?
Why is data placement important in distributed cache storage?
Which technique is commonly used to select a cache server in a distributed cache?
Why is consistent hashing preferred over simple hashing?
opts: It improves scalability and fault tolerance

q: Which data structure is commonly used to support eviction in cache servers?
Why is a doubly linked list suitable for cache eviction?
opts: It allows constant-time insert and delete

What is the main purpose of sharding in cache clusters?
Which cache deployment embeds cache and application on the same host?
